intro: Osbeckiastrum heudelotii, commonly known as the Brazilian sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Osbeckiastrum heudelotii is often found in coastal and inland regions where it contributes to local biodiversity.
